Selected Answer: D
D is the right answer, it is only 1 for automation project

Selected Answer: D
one Global Exception Handler
The Global Exception Handler is a type of workflow designed to determine the project's behavior when encountering an execution error. Only one Global Exception Handler can be set per automation project.

choices.C: Equal to the number of workflow files
choices.B: Equal to the number of Try Catch activities

questions.question_text:
A developer automated a business process using three automation projects. Each project file has several invoked workflow files. Before publishing, the developer wants to ensure all unexpected exceptions are caught.

How many Global Exception Handlers can be set?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the right ans.

Selected Answer: A
Final State of State Machine has only Entry State

Selected Answer: A
The State activity contains three sections, Entry, Exit and Transition(s), while the Final State only contains one section, Entry.

questions.question_text: What represents the section(s) of a Final State in a State Machine?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
i think it should be B

questions.question_text:
A developer created a process in a single .xaml file. The file includes the following steps:

1. Logs into a web application
2. Retrieves an Excel file
3. Reads the data from the Excel file
4. Inputs the data into another online application
5. Sends an email when the task is completed

Based on UiPath best practices, what are the next steps the developer should perform?

choices.A: Split the process steps into sequence activities, connect them using a flowchart, and test the sequences individually
choices.C: Ensure the process steps are placed in a single sequence activity and only the activities that throw errors should be tested
choices.B: Split the process steps into separate workflows and unit test the workflows
choices.D: Ensure the process steps are placed in a single sequence activity and then perform start-to-finish debugging

questions.question_text:
A process was running on multiple machines when a 20-minute system outage occurred. Although the process was able to complete successfully, the data the robots entered into the system was not saved correctly in the backend of the application during the outage. The team only needs to see when each Queue Item transaction started and ended, and then review the transactions that occurred during the time of the outage.

To ensure the logs provide this descriptive information about Transaction Start and End in Orchestrator, which logging level must be set?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Descriptive log messages are always Verbose

Selected Answer: D
The Verbose level logs a message for both the activity start and end, plus the values of the variables and arguments that are used.

By default, the Verbose level includes:

Execution Started log entry - generated every time a process is started.
Execution Ended log entry - generated every time a process is finalized.
Transaction Started log entry - generated every time a transaction item is obtained by the Robot from Orchestrator.
Transaction Ended log entry - generated every time the Robot sets the transaction status to either Success or Failed.
